Reviews.Title: “Management is Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: hahas
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my daughter and some friends and they ran into several issues. The hotel was ok, but left a lot to be desired. They were given conflicting information, depending on whom they spoke to at the front desk. Since August 2011, I have been trying to get a refund cheque from the manager Karim. He keeps on saying it is in the mail, but it is November now and I've yet to see it. He does not answer email anymore. I don't know who really runs the place, but they don't do a good job of it. Very disappointing - avoid! There are lots of great places to stay in Vancouver, so skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Daisy E
Reviews.Content: This place is like Faulty Towers! Avoid at all costs! During our stay somebody working at the hotel took quiet a few transactions from our debit account, despite paying for our stay in cash. When we confronted the manager he blamed the new girls on the front desk, mind you the girls on the desk were the only good thing about this place. After clearing the issue up more money vanished, this time the manager told us it was his computer. This place should be shut down, clearly something illegal is going on!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: DetailsMatterGuy
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here some years back and so, as a last minute booking, it seemed an ok idea. This despite the room charge was an obvious opportunity grab on a long weekend and about 4 times the lowest normal rate. The staff is clingy and not to bright. The room so basic it’s ridiculous. The beds hard as a rock. TV an old, small screen CRT type with limited channels. Lighting from grandma’s house. I had to unscrew one bulb because the wall light and bed light were on same switch. A kitchenette but all supplies locked up, not even a glass to use. Air-conditioning was an old nosy window shaker and to use it you had to leave open the curtains letting in the street light outside and the view of the neighbouring apartment dwellers across the ally. The bathroom very basic. Cheap toiletries, cheap toilet paper, NO Kleenex tissues anywhere in room. Small thin towels. Exhaust fan that was tied to light switch and made hearing impossible. I could go on but you get the idea. Worth $50 maybe, NOT $250! Then they screwed up my credit card by double billing the security and not communicating to night audit that a cash deposit had been made. Despite a number of pleas and providing the forums to be signed off it took an additional 42 days after staying there to get the credit hold of $328 removed from my card. I have been in the business and usually am pretty forgiving but these operators should be put out of business. Canada Select 3 star rating - what a joke. Will be advising both Canada Select and credit card companies to dump these losers.

Reviews.Title: “Like An Old Friend....”
Reviews.Author: samdeeds
Reviews.Content: As I write this review, I realize that I have stayed at the Robsonstrasse--infrequently--for more than ten years. Over all that time, I have never been disappointed. "Dolly" and Ashif are a constant, hospitable presence, always seeking to maximize the comfort of their guests. On this visit, a glitch in the online reservation system--combined with the inexperience of a front desk clerk--left me and two friends without rooms! (And this was on the evening of the International Fireworks to Music Competition!) With patience and diligence, both Ashif and "Dolly" worked to solve the immediate problem, as well as determining how to prevent the problem from ever happening in the future. The bathroom and other facility renovations were new to me and a very positive addition. We were placed in a Robson Street-side room which was a bit noisy. I've always preferred the back rooms, despite their lack of a "view." The Robsonstrasse is like an old friend. I'm always glad to be back in touch, always happy to share past experiences, always looking toward the comforts of familiarity--despite the fact that their hair might be mussed or that I don't agree with their choices in wardrobe. I would agree with every positive thing said about the Robsonstrasse and would dispute the perceptions of those who speak negatively about my old pal.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!!”
Reviews.Author: vancity_83
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review as a resident of Vancouver that lives within a block of this dump. Unfortunately I can't comment on the friendliness of the hotel staff. I can however tell you that I've been a neighbor of the Robsonstrasse Hotel for nearly four years, and walk by it on a daily basis and in almost every passing the filthiness of this eyesore is a topic of conversation. From the looks of it they cut their grass about once a year, therefore making it a perfect place for mice to roam,which they do, and piles of dog poop to remain for weeks on end. These may seem like minor nit-picky complaints but they are such easy things to control. They need to have a little pride in their establishments appearance. The fact that they are too lazy to deal with such minor issues makes me wonder what awaits a Vancouver tourist when they check-in here. I don't mean to sound like a "Negative Nancy" because I'm not. I created this account solely for the purpose of writing this review. I will be more than happy to remove this review if they can clean up their act but until then I'd recommend staying away from this dump at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book at Robsonstrasse Hotel & Suites (Vancouver)”
Reviews.Author: Mme_Leduc
Reviews.Content: I booked a room, two months in advance, at Robsonstrasse Hotel & Suites (using the reservation tool on their website) ... 7 days before my arrival, their system has cancelled my reservation !!! They argued that I had made a mistake with my credit card number. Even if true, how could I know ?... I received a confirmation from them after my booking ! 5 days, 2 long distance calls and 10 emails later, they were still unable to solve that problem. So, I had to book somewhere else in 2 days notice...At a time when, among other things, a Conference of 8000 participants and a Stanley Cup finals were held in town - I was very close to do camping in Stanley Park! They did not offer me another room. They did not offer me compensation. They did not even apologize for the inconvenience. My advice: Do not trust them, book another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location nice hotel, let down by a few things”
Reviews.Author: stunew15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, however all the places on Robson street seem to close fairly early. The hotel were particular with what you cooked which was explained to us when we moved in, however we werent aware how particular the management would be. The cooker in the room didnt have an extractor fan and therefore anything being cooked on the hob, in the oven or in the toaster would set off the smoke alarm on a near daily basis. We were recommended the only way round this would be to open all the windows and switch the air conditioner on full blast, which in mid january is not ideal in your pyjamas! While most of the staff were friendly and helpful, the old woman who works there (although we're not sure as we were told various stories of her role in this hotel by herself) really let this hotel down. On various occasions she was rude and said inappropriate and offensive(at times) statements. One such story was that her husband had died and the manager made her work all the hours he could, however about a week later she then told us that her and her husband ran this hotel as well as the hotel over the road. pretty impressive for a dead person! And another was discussing inappropriate 9/11 views which I found shocking and offensive. Other than this it was a good place to stay for the month we spent in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Now a Permanent Fixture Here”
Reviews.Author: PrairieGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I have become a permanent fixture for this hotel and, though, I do not get to come out this way very often I always choose to stay at the Robsonstrasse. They have been nothing but amazing to me; the manager and all of the staff. I would not stay in any other hotel now that I've come to know the wonderful staff of this establishment and that's why it pains me to see all these horrible reviews geared towards this nice, but older, hotel. People are so horribly vindictive when they do not get their way and or have been caught with their proverbial pants down. I have felt nothing but safe and secure at the Robsonstrasse for any and all of my previous stays and every time I return they take excellent care of me to the best of their abilities. Now I understand everyone wants a five star treatment, but it is easy to understand that as a boutique styled hotel, that is in no way apart of some massive chain, they are limited in what they CAN do for their guests. However, they always make up for it with their clean, affordable rooms (if a little on the older side), upgrades for return guests (if they so desire) and a friendly atmosphere. Even their new day clerks gave their best in trying to assist me with restaurants to dine at and a few other sights I had not seen or even thought of to check. Like I have mentioned in my other postings to this site; I will always return for a stay at the Robsonstrasse. Thank you so much for, yet another, wonderful stay. Do take care and I hope to be back again.

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER be disappointed here”
Reviews.Author: PrairieGrrrl
Reviews.Content: As usual the Robsonstrasse and it's happy staff never disappoint me. My sister and I decided to travel out to the wonderfully green city of Vancouver once again and as is the norm for me now we stayed at the Robsonstrasse. We were greeted with warm smiles from the ever helpful staff who upgraded us to a larger suit (for the same price) just, because I am a return guest. I never get this treatment at any of the other hotels I stay at. If I upgrade at any other hotel I have been charged applicably for it....not much, but still charged none the less. I was pleasantly shocked when I arrived at the hotel this time around as they have apparently given the building a bit of a make-over. A whole new coat of paint (nice and bright) and a brand new sign (time and all included). Not only that, but even the rooms have been renewed and are even better than my last stay. The beds have spring, the appliances are shiny and new and there is now free WiFi! All this and the wonderful staff just added up to a superb stay! I shall return again. They will never be rid of me. :)

Reviews.Title: “Do not ever stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MikeF21
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst hotel in terms of value that I have ever been to. The lobby hadn't been vacuumed in well over a week, there were piles junk everywhere (I have the pictures to prove it) and our two room suite only had one window unit air conditioner. I had to sleep on the floor in the room with the air conditioner because the other room was so hot. I've stayed in better hotels for $50 a night, let alone the $239 they charged us. We left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Robsonstrasse”
Reviews.Author: stev1470
Reviews.Content: The Robsonstrasse exceeded my expectations, providing a spacious room, comfortable bed, VERY clean hotel, and excellent location. If you're looking for a boutique-type hotel (and are okay with sacrificing large resort-type amenities), this is probably Vancouver's best option. The staff is very friendly, and they operate with the goal of obtaining guest loyalty. After returning home, I had a question about my bill and emailed the hotel; they returned my message within twenty minutes and we were able to resolve my confusion. The Robsonstrasse is a great deal for travelers, and I will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your time here”
Reviews.Author: Calgarygaytravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel cancelled our large group reservation despite having written confirmation. We had sent emails and phoned to verify that everything would be great with our reservations which were made months ahead of time, but when we arrived our reservations had been cancelled. No explanation was offered and staff were completely ignorant. The Hotel manager and booking agents in particular do not help you at all. They didn't offer to help us in any way or compensate us for the problems and said they were now fully booked. I had read the bad reviews but since it was cheap and in a good location, decided to go ahead anyways- Don't! Do not even bother to waste your time despite what any other review or the 'hotel manager' who comments on these reviews says.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl154943
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Robsonstrasse when I'm in Vancouver. It is clean and affordable. They have upgraded me a few times, at no extra charge, because I am a regular customer. It is right on Robson Street, so the location is great. Taxi service is easy to find also. Parking is in a secure place and is watched by video. Your room key is needed to Access the elevator so that makes visitors feel secure. Rooms are air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “The service is very good”
Reviews.Author: colahuang
Reviews.Content: As a foreign traveler there, I was impressed they patiently helped me with many problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pacificgun
Reviews.Content: I thought it is a nice hotel. It was a good stay and I would stay again. The Staff are helpful and the service good. The room was very nice and the beds comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SueOnerom
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; friendly staff; good housekeeping and good value, and also secure. We enjoyed walking around in Robson street commercial area. If you are taking a cruise this is a great option also because it is just a few minutes away from the ports

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: doctordilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed there and had a great time, loved the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GagneA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with nice,clean and comfortable rooms.Really good location.Excellent management.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK 2010 OLYMPICS ALSO”
Reviews.Author: Notahappycamper100
Reviews.Content: The exact same thing happened to me as UnhappyOlympicGuest . You cannot speak with a live person regarding your problem and they even stopped replying to my emails. I had to contact the credit card company to get the money back. It took 1 1/2 months to recover this. Not only this, it only left me a few months to find other accomodations for the Olympics.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book - 2010 Olympics”
Reviews.Author: unhappyOlympicGuest
Reviews.Content: Like the last reviewer, I had my reservation for the 2010 Olympics canceled by the hotel several weeks ago. I had booked my stay back in Dec 2008 and they had already charged my credit card the full amount. They claimed that the online booking system we were using experienced a computer glitch that had canceled the reservation. However, during numerous attempts to determine the status of our reservation we were never allowed to talk to anyone other than the front desk clerk and were given a generic email address that appeared to be answered only by their IT guy (and over the past week+ several emails have gone unanswered). It appears that they are either overbooking rooms or cancelling existing reservations if they determine they can relist them for a higher rate. We have still not received a full refund for our reservation and have had to dispute the charges with our credit card company. This hotel has unethical business practices and should be avoided!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing as always”
Reviews.Author: PrairieGrrrl
Reviews.Content: I'm repeat business with this hotel and as always I was treated wonderfully and even given a free upgrade to a larger room for the booking price ($84 + tax) of a standard guest room. I'm always well taken care of while staying at the Robsonstrasse. The staff are always friendly and curteous. They do their hardest to make all the guests happy even if they are treated like scum. They go above and beyond to assist everyone to the best of their abilities. Infact they made tour bookings for me if I requested them and even informed me of great places to eat and where I shouldn't go at certain times of the day. I never receive this kind of care in any of the other hotels I stay at and frankly I equated it to my younger age (mid twenties). Chain hotels treat me like a parasite, but the staff of the Robsonstrasse treat me as a value customer. The rooms are still as clean as I remember from my last trip. The beds are still very well maintained. And now they are even looking into further renos to make the hotel even nicers. I will tell all of you people who look at the reviews on this site that you can not judge a book by it's cover. Every damn hotel will have it's problems not matter what, but in the end I equate a good stay to helpful staff and the willingness to fix whatever problems may occur. I will be returning to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place? yes! clean? not so”
Reviews.Author: dooby1203
Reviews.Content: great people and an excellent location though the blood stains on the sheets were a little gross

Reviews.Title: “OLYMPIC VISITORS AND OTHERS BEWARE - QUESTIONABLE BUSINESS PRACTICES”
Reviews.Author: FamilyKelowna_BC
Reviews.Content: Those looking for Olympic accommodations BEWARE. Read reviews below and also call the Better Business Bureau at [-] to review reports on this Hotel. Also contact [-] as they are reviewing this hotel. Tourism BC will not allow hotels who conduct themselves in such a manner to state that they are an “approved accommodation.” The owner of this hotel has a history of canceling your reservations or “cannot find it.” We had booked our reservations for the Olympics, the owner/manager cancelled them, changed the website and increased the daily rates. Despite leaving a number of messages and emails, he would not return them. He would not honor the rates that were quoted to us at the time of our original booking. As this seems to be a common thread (read reviews) and it is the Olympics you may not want to risk booking with this hotel as accommodations at that time will be scarce and you may not find alternative last minute accommodations. Who knows with this guy if he will cancel your reservations last minute and again increase the rates. He has questionable business practices. I would keep looking as booking with hotel is too risky especially during the Olympics when you do not have many alternatives. I am willing to be contacted to share my experience with this hotel if you need more information.. Good luck....

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PulpBabe
Reviews.Content: I booked by phoning the Hotel. Although the reservation clerk seems preoccupied and placed me on HOLD I eventually booked the room and gave him my credit card number. I did ask him about the parking and he told me how I could get access to the gated secure parking that the hotel has prior to checking in. This was extremely helpful as there is NO PARKING in front of the hotel. Upon checking in (had booked a room with a King size bed), we told that the room had a leak but that they would upgrade us to a suite for the same price. We asked about accessing the internet and were informed that there is a $12.95 fee per day (we thought this was fairly steep as we had free internet at all the previous hotels/motels that we stayed) I asked if they required an imprint of my credit card and they said No as long as the information was the same as when I reserved. The clerk was very friendly and answered any questions we had. The elevator is very secure (must scan your room key before elevator moves). The room was clean and we had wrapped plastic & styrofoam cups & coffee (coffee pot of course). We thought that having disposable cups were a great idea as I had watched a program of TV not long before on the amount of germs (not properly washed) being left on glass cups & glasses in hotel/motel rooms. As I could not find the ice bucket, I went downstairs to Reception. I asked her where the ice machine was and she indicatated that she would have to get the ice for me as it was in a secure area (employees only). I also asked her for a couple more plastic cups. She brought me both the ice and the plastice cups. She was very pleasant the entire time. Back to the room. The room was clean but the furniture is old and in our room we did have a broken chair (which we informed the receptionist about). As there were 2 other chairs to sit around the table, we did not have a problem. The fridge worked excellently as did the microwave. We found the beds were clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and it had all the little extras in it (shampoo, condiitoner, shower cap) and soap (of course). We had enough towels, 2 face cloths, 2 hand towels and 2 bath towels. The used towels were exchanged for clean towels daily. We closed the windows and put the air conditioning on and the outside noise was not heard. We had extremely great sleeps with no interruptions. As we were out of the hotel for most of the day & evening (during our 7 day stay), we found this hotel to be "just what we needed" as it was close to everywhere we wanted to go and the price was agreeable as September is still considered High Season". Again, when we asked the staff for extras "more coffee, cups, etc", they were very accommodating and pleasant. We had a very positive experience staying at this hotel and we would recommend it to anyone who wants to be downtown Vancouver and within walking distance of many of the places you want to see including shopping and fantastic restaurants. We will definitely be staying at the Robsonstrasse Hotel again. I would even give it a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Robsonstrasse !”
Reviews.Author: TinoTai
Reviews.Content: My little lady and I were in town from Bangkok in early August 2008 and were extremely delighted with the service and comfort of the Robsonstrasse hotel. The beds were the most comfortable we had slept in on our entire trip and the location was incredible. For an inexpensive, clean, safe and friendly hotel, check in to the Robsonstrasse! We'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: SirCaramel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located and close to most Vancouver attractions. The room was clean and provided basic comfort but no frills. These are the only good things about this hotel. We experienced many irritants: -no glasses, mugs or ice buckets (we were told that they were not provided since guests kept stealing them, which raised questions about the clientele!); after much asking styrofoam cups were provided -this is the only hotel I've been in my life where they demand xerox copies of your driver's license and CC. -soap holder was broken in the shower. -service was not too friendly. -parking is puny, could never find space to park inside. -elevators and corridors need serious revamping. I've stayed at much nicer and friendlier hotels for lower prices, so this was not so great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: cemerson
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here after realizing that every other hotel under $250 was fully booked for the long weekend, so I wasn't expecting that much. The room's decor was certainly not chic, but it was clean and spacious and the beds were comfy The staff was really nice, and the free parking was a plus. The location is great - walking distance to Stanley Park, West End, Granville. We were there for a big fireworks display and the staff let guests view from the hotel roof - thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Travelmefar
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Robsonstrasse was horrible. I went into the hotel a few days before my stay to make sure that my reservation was all in place. The fellow at the front desk was not able to find my reservation. The hotel manager left and came back with a copy of my booking, saying that it was all good. I had booked a King size bed for 3 nights. Upon arrival the first night, (it was almost 1am) I was informed that my reservation had been cancelled. I had not been contacted or notified. The fellow at the front desk said that he put me in a room of equal value which was 2 Double beds. I went into the room, and in the bathroom there was no basket with soap or facecloths, shampoo or lotion, no cups. I was then woken up at 10:45 the next morning (when I had a reservation for 3 nights) because somebody else had that specific room booked for early the next day. Why not just put me in a room that I would not have been disturbed in? I went down to the front desk to check out, and was notified by an older asian fellow that he was sorry for the inconvenience, but would provide me with a key for a King size room for the next 2 nights. A key card was provided at that time. When I came back that night, the room that was assigned to me, was again 2 Double beds. After being promised a King size bed this was not Kosher. The room itself was not clean. The far bed had a shelf at the foot for luggage, the back of the shelf was missing a strip that had been broken off, and was laying on the first bed. The room did not look like it had been vaccuumed by the bedside table. The bathroom was missing a bath mat for the floor, and the 2 cups. The bathtub and sink also had a green film from the nickel content in the water. Under the bathroom sink was dirty, some kind of a dried brown stain. I notified the front desk person of these problems and they took down a list, they advised me it would be passed on to the manager. I left the next morning and came back for the 3rd night. The bathtub and sink still had the green film, the cups were still missing in the bathroom. The brown stain under the sink was still there. There was a bathmat this time, the broken off board from the luggage rack had been removed, but the floor by the bedside table had still not been vaccuumed. A lightbulb in the entranceway was burnt out. Also various parts of the room were dusty (the headboards, the t.v.) The window ledge in the room was also a brown color, when it was supposed to be a pink that matched the rest of the room, but it was so dirty it did not just wipe right off. When I voiced my complaint to the manager when I was checking out, he could not be bothered to even come down to the front desk, and took my complaints over the phone. His excuse for me not getting the room that I had booked, was that there was a leak. The fellow working the front desk the next morning had promised me a King size bed and had downright lied to me. The manager said that it was because the room was not available, but that was no excuse for being lied to. I was also advised that the reason there was a green film in the tubs and sinks was not because the cleaning ladies were not doing their jobs, but because the brand of cleaning product that they used, was not as efficient as the previous one. However, I was able to wipe off some of the green film with nothing more than a kleenex and some water. For all of my inconvenience, I was only given a 10% discount on my second night, which totalled all of about $14. My total before the discount was $410 and after was $395.71. Not sufficient enough for all the mistakes and the general uncleanliness of the room. Not to mention a very pushy and rude older lady at the front desk, who is insistent upon making everything that happens part of her business, even if she has nothing to do with it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel.. avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: seacamel
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding recently in Vancouver BC. My Mother stayed at the Robsonstrasse on Robson street. This hotel was absolutely unfriendly in manner to guests. For example, there were 3 men in Tuxedos waiting in the lobby while I went to get my mother. The three well dressed and very respectable men were told to wait out side as they did not like so many people loitering in the lobby as they put it. I was then promptly told that they would kick my mother out if we had these guests up to the room as there is a strict no visitors plan in effect. What?? Totally ridiculous... I told them so and left. They then threatened my mother again when she later came back. The second most unimpressive item is the telephone charges applied to the room. $1.50 per minute after 2 minutes it went to $2.00 per minute. This was not told to our party upon check in even after our inquiry as to how to use the room phone.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: takeninvancouver
Reviews.Content: Found bug in one bed in one room, and hairs on pillow in another room (multiple rooms in our party). When confronted, housekeeping supervisor capitulated and released one of our party from their obligation to stay, they immediately checked out. Rooms appeared to be clean, but the above problems were unnerving. We were told bug was possibly a carpet beetle, but that they "only lived in the carpets and wouldn't go home with us on our luggage" (then why was it in the sheets?). Decided to stay (mistake?) in spite of this due to the hassle of changing and lugging luggage back down the tiny elevator to a taxi again, finding new accommodations, the money we'd lose as the room was already charged to our card, not to mention the "lost" day in Vancouver (our only one there). Also, saw a room rate on one of these sites saying rooms were cheap at $109, not true! We paid $184 per night! Not too happy with our travel agent...

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Happy-in-Seattle
Reviews.Content: I submitted a review last August but it was never published. I was also very surprised by these other reviews. Could not agree more with a recent review that the room itself was fairly clean, and the location is good, but the lobby, garage, elevator and hallways were really nasty. The garage (parking was free) but it is very difficult to get into a tiny parking space. The airconditioning could not keep up with cooling the room on hot summer day. The staff was very unprofessional there seem to be problem there. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: FromMichigan
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a week long stay (despite mixed reviews) based on the price and location. We were very pleased with the location. It was easy to get everywhere either walking or by bus and there were many places to eat within walking distance. It was close to Stanley Park and Downtown. We (two women) felt comfortable walking around at night. The room was spacious and we appreciated having the refrigerator, sink, microwave and coffee maker (including coffee). The room was clean but the decor left something to be desired. Nothing in the lobby except tourist brochures. Overall, would recommend this hotel to other travellers who do not require delux accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “new mgmt? Won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very surprised by these other reviews. We booked this hotel last minute because everyting else downtown was full. The room itself was fairly clean, and the location is good, but the lobby, garage, elevator and hallways were really nasty. I can only guess they've recently changed hands, as it looks like it used to be a Best Western type of place, but they obviously no longer have the staff to keep up with it. Dishes, trash and laundry piled in hallwas all day??? The garage (parking was free) was piled with garbage and old florescent lightbulbs. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: travelholChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Robstonstrasse Hotel on May 30-June 3, 2006. It is well located - On Robson St in the midst of many restaurants, a few blocks from several internet cafes ($1 for 1/2 hr), and 1/2 block from the #5 Robson St bus. People at the front desk were not particularly friendly. The lobby looks a bit rundown. The room would be very small but for the "suite" aspect - an alcove with a kitchen area and a small table and chairs. No luggage racks. There were no dishes in the kitchen, but I think you can pay extra and get them. We paid $99 Canadian per night during the week and $119 C on Sat. night.This is expensive but everything in Vancouver is expensive (food is much more than in Chicago, for example, in comparable places). The room was clean. The bathroom was small but not tiny. Bed was reasonably firm. They need more lights for reading. It was hard to read in the room. I thought of going out and buying a higher watt bulb. The tv had the most stations of any we stayed at in our 3 week trip. There is a laundry room in the basement which costs C$4 to wash and C$2 to dry. However, it is only available to hotel guests from 6:30p.m. to 11 p.m. You need to take a bus to most locations. It is a bit far to walk. I would stay here again if I could not find anything cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, very central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Robsonstraase from 29/9/05 for 5 nights. Although the room was basic and the decor a bit old fashioned it was very clean and comfortable. The housekeeping each day was to a high standard. The hotel is very central for touring around Vancouver, approx 15 min walk to Stanley Park and very close to the harbour. We would definitely recommend if you are going for an active holiday and not to lounge in your bedroom all day. Also there is a fab little creperie about a 5 min walk from there (when u come out of the hotel turn right, go as far as the starbucks at the corner and then go left and it is just on the left hand side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Great Management, Free and Safe Parking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night stay -- staff couldn't have been better. Upgraded us to a one bedroom, which was greatly appreciated. Very clean and quiet. Free parking behind hotel -- behind an iron gate -- secure and well lighted. Walking distance to everything on Robson and the area. Only issue is they need to provide a few supplies for the kitchenette (paper towels and trash -- perhaps dish soap). An excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “They ruined my wedding and didn't care”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wedding is in early September in Vancouver. I am not from Vancouver. I had reserved 8 rooms for my extended family at the end of May. I called to add a room on Aug. 7. The reservation had been lost. I tried to rebook, and was told that "there are a pile of faxes on the Reservation Manager's desk and he will call you tomorrow." I never heard from him, and was never able to make contact with him. I was not allowed to rebook owing to the size of my booking. 3 days later, following 1 or 2 calls per day (I'm not exaggerating - I left 2 voicemails and spoke to 5 people), a front desk clerk finally helped me rather than saying I had to wait for the Reservation Manager. She offered a rate of 119, whereas I had initially booked at 109. I said ok. She called back 2 hours later and said she had been forced to cancel, as the minimum charge was 129. I am livid. Clearly, I haven't stayed there, but God knows I've tried to.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got a room at the Robsonstrasse after leaving a horrible room at the Greenbrier across the street. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was beautifully rennovated, spotless, ordorless and nicely furnished. Stayed there on a long weekend and did not hear a sound from the other rooms - that's a first! The entire building is smoke free and very clean. Free secured parking. Had a wonderful weekend and I would definately stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Robsonstrasse Hotel & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1394 Robson St, Vancouver, British Columbia V6E 1C5, Canada
